channel.title: Playing a RSPS in school :/
channel.description:
Ok, well i am going to get to the point, i stay after school for 1 hour every day, casue i have to wait untill my mum finishes work, i cant be botherd to work after school so i wanted tot try and play a RSPS server?
i connected to a webclient or and server when i try to connect on school i alway get error....is it possible to play an rsps on school? if so how?

item.title: Playing a RSPS in school :/
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

public boolean:

Just another problem CMD is blocked, shall i just use command.com?

Its the same thing!

Read full topic

item.title: Playing a RSPS in school :/
item.dc:creator: @public_boolean public boolean
item.description:
@public_boolean wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:4, topic:274542”]You’ll need to hack the firewall in that case. If you can get onto cmd.exe and your network administrator uses a stupid login and password its easy.
Go onto www.ipchicken.com to find out the IP of the machine.
Then on cmd type telnet 255.255.255.255 (replace 255… with IP)
Then if you can guess the password you should be able to unblock some ports and passwords[/quote]

its not that easy guessing a school admins pass…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 20, 2009, 05:50:12 am[/size][hr]Just another problem CMD is blocked, shall i just use command.com?

Read full topic

item.title: Playing a RSPS in school :/
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

You’ll need to hack the firewall in that case. If you can get onto cmd.exe and your network administrator uses a stupid login and password its easy.
Go onto www.ipchicken.com to find out the IP of the machine.
Then on cmd type telnet 255.255.255.255 (replace 255… with IP)
Then if you can guess the password you should be able to unblock some ports and passwords.

By default most firewalls use:
login: admin
password: admin

Read full topic

item.title: Playing a RSPS in school :/
item.dc:creator: @public_boolean public boolean
item.description:
@public_boolean wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:2, topic:274542”]If your school filtering system allows you to go onto websites using direct IPs upload a client and a simple archiver onto a direct hoster (www.hoster.com/client.zip) (www.hoster.com/unzip.exe) then ping the website to retrieve the IP of the website (255.255.255.255). After that you should hopefully be able to download and extract stuff at school and run a client.

I personally cannot do this because i cannot go onto webistes using direct IPs.[/quote]

the problem isnt getting onto the site, im just getting errors while trying to connect.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing a RSPS in school :/
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

If your school filtering system allows you to go onto websites using direct IPs upload a client and a simple archiver onto a direct hoster (www.hoster.com/client.zip) (www.hoster.com/unzip.exe) then ping the website to retrieve the IP of the website (255.255.255.255). After that you should hopefully be able to download and extract stuff at school and run a client.

I personally cannot do this because i cannot go onto webistes using direct IPs.

Read full topic
